body:
sdustinh, please include the CakePHP version number you are using in your description. It helps us debug your issue.

--
_Automated response by [Var.CI](https://var.ci)_ :robot:

issue.title: Var.CI should accept `composer show` output

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body: Var.CI should accept CakePHP version number from `composer show` output as in https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/12509

body: We could change the check in `IntegerType::toDatabase()` from `is_scalar()` to `is_numeric()` instead, so that an exception is thrown instead of value being implicitly truncated.
`IntegerType::manyToPHP()` also does casting to int and could cause the same issue.
How do you use both types interchangeably?
The best we can do is to throw an exception, which by the looks of what you are doing, is definitely not what you want, as it would break your nice finder.
Definitely throw the exception - that is what is best for the framework. My application should not dictate what is best for the framework. I'll handle relevant changes on my end.
@sdustinh Any interest in putting together a pull request for this?
@markstory Of course. Just the changes discussed? `is_scalar()` -> `is_numeric()` okay for everyone?
@markstory On the `manyToPHP()` do you want to `continue` or throw the exception?

issue.title: Check for `is_numeric()` instead of `is_scalar()` on IntegerType

milestone.description: Enhancements for the next 3.x feature release.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

body: I went ahead and just piggy backed the `continue`. If you want me to change it, let me know and I'll update the PR.

issue.title: Patching non well formed field of type decimal on 3.7.0

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [ ] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 3.7.0
* Change in commit: e960656f2a8806f705ec124558963bb1969034ad
* File causing issue: src/Database/Type/DecimalType.php:106

### What you did
Our code is trying to marshall non well formed decimal value (string using comma as decimal separator) into DecimalType database field, which worked up to change in commit mentioned above. 

### What happened
DecimalType method marshall returned null due to removal of !is_scalar($value) condition.

### What you expected to happen
Method should return value if it's scalar as it did in previous version (up to specified commit) as values could be parsed to correct format by entity setters.
